Answer.def: Simply put authentication is the process of verifying who some is whereas authorization is the process of verifying what specific applications files and data a usr has access to the situation is like that  of an airline thant needs to determine which people can come on board
authentication: Authentication verifies who the user is
Authentication works through passwords one time pins biometric information and other information provided or entered by the user
Authentication is visible to and partially changeable by the user
Example verifying their identity emplyess can gain access to an HR application that includes their personal pay information vactation times
Authorization: Authorization determines what resources a user can access
Authorization works through settings that are implemented and maintained by the organization
Authorization always takes place after authentication
Authorization is not visible to or changeable by the user.
Example Once their level of access is authorized employees and HR manager can access different levels of data based on the permissions set by the organization
